title: Angel Family Chicken Soup with Matzo Balls

Ingredients.2: 3  parsnips, peeled and cut into bite-size pieces

Ingredients.3: 7 large carrots, cut into bite-size pieces

Ingredients.4: 1 bunch celery, cut into bite-size pieces

Ingredients.13: 1  rotisserie chicken, bones removed and meat cut into bite-size pieces

Directions.1: Place raw chicken in a large stockpot.

Directions.2: Add parsnips, carrots, celery, onion, dill, and parsley to the stockpot; cover with water, and boil until the chicken is 200 degrees F (95 degrees C) or begins to fall apart, about 1 hour.

Directions.3: Remove chicken from the stock and set aside for another use.

Directions.4: Whisk together eggs and oil in a medium-sized mixing bowl.

Directions.5: Add matzo meal to the bowl with eggs and oil, stirring until well combined. Cover and refrigerate for 20 minutes.

Directions.6: Remove matzo mixture from the refrigerator and gently hand-roll into 1 inch balls. Be careful not to over-roll as this can make the matzo balls tough.

Directions.7: In a separate pot, heat chicken stock. Place matzo balls into the stock and simmer until they are soft, at least 1 hour.

Directions.8: Transfer the matzo balls into the soup pot with the vegetables. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Directions.9: To serve, place pieces of the roasted chicken into soup bowls and ladle the chicken soup with matzo balls over it. Enjoy!
